page.title: 15ST. CLERES HALL
page.content: St. Cleres Hall is said to be an area of some 1550 acres.The actual hall that now stands was owned by the St.Clere family from the time of 1291 but again there is no actual evidence that the present building was standing then.The back of the house is definitely older than the front.It has been told that the back part dates to the 13th century,and that the front elevation is quite new-18th-19th century.St.Cleres Hall has a very beautiful barn dated at 1582.There is another barn,just as old,but in a very bad state of repair.The basic walls are approximately 36 cms thick made from stone with brick facing.The ceilings in most rooms are lathe and plaster.The actual house that now stands on the site was definitely not there at the time of William the Conquerer.
